Description: Fragment of an ostracon that was incised after the pottery vessel was fired. The ostracon shows some hieroglyphs facing to the right: a possible sw-plant with an arm perpendicular to the stem, like M27 but with one row of leaves (M22), the leaves are angular instead of rounded. Behind a t on top of a bird (something between a Falcon G5 and a swallow G35). Two further sign that are not legible anymore. The vessel was made of Nile clay, closed shape, wheel made and bears a red slip on the outside.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.1, upper level
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 71)
